content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the endpoint is changed to the previous point, the new shortest path should be the original shortest path minus the last point.)

The shortest path from node 0 to node 4 in the provided graph is:

1->2->3

Note that the shortest path may include nodes that are not explicitly shown in the provided graph. In this case, the path includes nodes 1, 2, and 3, but they are not explicitly represented in the graph. The order of these nodes does not matter for the shortest path calculation.

The shortest path from node 0 to node 2 in the provided graph is:

0->1->3

Note that the shortest path may include nodes that are not explicitly shown in the provided graph. In this case, the path includes nodes 0, 1, and 3, but they are not explicitly represented in the graph. The order of these nodes does not matter for the shortest path calculation.
